title: Autofill Consistently Ruining High MMR Match Quality
body:
I'm not complaining about the one time I got autofilled to ADC and fed my ass off. I'm complaining about it consistently deciding the game outcome based on who gets filled where. Here's why it's a terrible idea:

1. We don't even get the option to opt out and decide for ourselves that we don't think its worth it to risk getting placed in our worst role in exchange for queue time.

2. I'm sure MOST people would want to sacrifice a few minutes of their queue times to avoid autofill.

3. We've been playing Dynamic Queue for about half a year without this restriction so many of us who knew how to play their worst three roles at a level at least one tier below their rank in the past DON'T KNOW HOW ANYMORE. The damage has already been dealt.

4. Yeah I've won several games because the enemy 1-trick Akali got filled to ADC, but I detest games that are decided by factors like this. NO ONE likes volatility. It's the reason why people ban champions with sub-50% winrates. They're scared of the random Leblanc that will solo carry a game even though most of the time, it's not an issue.

5. Games are volatile, as one player can drag an entire team down more in this season than ever before.

I've got a D2 account and a Master account so it's a bit less than 1% of playerbase affected I'd say so Riot can just shrug it off. BUT A SIMPLE FIX. Oh, and by the way, I'm writing this during my dodge timer after my one-trick Zac got autofilled support while my one-trick Darius got autofilled mid.


Edit: Most of you bring up the point of autofill creating sustainability in queue times and reference the start of the season where queue times were extremely excessive. Again, the fix I'm suggesting preserves BOTH the values of short queue time and higher match quality/good role select. You DON'T HAVE to opt out. You can simply leave autofill on and enjoy your shorter queue time IF you value that more than your risk of getting filled. IF autofill were on for everybody (like it is now), the people that can deal with it and fill will STILL get their games potentially ruined by their teammates who CANNOT. If you try to make sense of it, you will conclude that the longer queue times that this solution yields are the results of people that are GUARANTEED TO RUIN MATCH QUALITY, not have the potential possibility to. You essentially ELIMINATE the ENTIRE complaints threads for autofill. 

Another point regarding queue times is that autofill was implemented roughly the same time as other queue time fixes were implemented so it is a confounding factor in all of this as the other fixes (which you guys haven't mentioned) have been huge in cutting our queue times (not just autofill). These are factors like limiting premade size (to 3) and making MMR boundaries stricter for premades and tweaking matchmaking system algorithm's metrics (MMR, Primary Role Placement, Premade Size, Leniency). 

And for those of you saying we can just ask our teammates for their roles; it will work sometimes, but less frequently now. I can refer you to the 3rd point I made in the post. Also, it happens to multiple people at the same time. Almost every champion select I get into, the first words I see in chat are "fucking autofilled." ALMOST. EVERY. TIME.

replies.body:
I won't argue that high level matchmaking doesn't have issues, but I think that you underestimate the effect that opting out of autofill will have.  As you said, MOST people would avoid autofill given the option, especially at your level where it is so competitive and everyone is looking for an edge.  And especially because on an individual level, it doesn't look like you are giving up a lot to choose to opt out.  

The problem is that if everyone does so, then the matchmaking would go back to how it was at the beginning of the season, where I understand there were very big rank disparities in a given match, which is essentially the same problem.  To have good matchmaking and no autofill, queue times would be way longer than just a few minutes more.  Probably like an hour or two on a good day.  It's simply impossible to guarantee roles for ten people when there are barely that many at that level in the queue.  It's unsustainable to not have autofill, and although the return transition period will be painful, it has to be done.

I would suggest that if someone claims to be autofilled and cannot play his role, don't dodge for them.  Make them dodge.  That's basically the way to opt out of autofill right now.  Yes, it's a higher penalty, but it has to be.  It has to be difficult to get out of autofill, or else everyone will do it.  Make them either dodge or get better at other roles.

Well said, but I believe the higher queue time issue is kinda exaggerated at this point. A lot of the issues earlier on in the season were solved gradually with cutting premade sizes in Dia+ and adjusting the metrics of the matchmaking system (MMR, roles, premade pairing, leniency). It's hard to tell because autofill came in at the same time as these changes leading it to be confounding.

There are certainly a lot of factors that can influence the queue times, so I agree that it's hard to know exactly what would happen with any change.  The estimated queue time based on role is another thing they've since added that could change how people queue if they see long wait times.

You know, I think that with effective communication, they could test an 'opt out of auto-fill' option, or other solutions.  If they say beforehand that it's a test for like a week, and highlight options for decreasing the queue time for players who value that aspect higher, it might not go over so poorly.  Especially with the potential benefit.  And we'd get to see what would happen either way.  My belief is that they have models to estimate queue times, and have chosen not to remove auto-fill because the trade-off is too great.  But in the end, they're just simulations - human behavior can be unpredictable.

A ranked game where your players are playing roles they don't play at all is not a game worth playing AT ALL. I'm sure if a player one-tricks something or strongly mains 2 roles but doesn't play the others gets autofilled, they would rather not play that game AT ALL. It's not only a waste of time because they lose (and thus wasted the time of their previous win as well) but it's NOT FUN to play that role (which is why they don't play it) 

For me, I'd rather sit and wait for 40 extra minutes in queue for the theoretical game to finish than for it to place me as ADC or something. And I'm sure all of my teammates would rather I'm not on their team as ADC. They can wait another few minutes for another ADC player, I guarantee they would all be okay with actually having someone who plays the role be on their team with it.  

The problem is that this is happening in high MMR where there are less players to pick from, and where the skill disparity between player's roles is much bigger. Like what if in LCS or Worlds they were like oh, well, someone who is a star mid player just got autofilled to ADC. They don't play that role. They can most likely play it better than most players in the world, but they don't play it at the level that they are competing at. Same thing here. I can play ADC at a level higher than most players in the world (statistically 95%+) since I'm simply a better player... but compared to other players at my rank, my ADC is shit. And that's the problem, you can't just have someone 'get better at other roles'. 

When you are at a certain ranking because you got there by playing only your main role/champions, how are you expected to suddenly play a role you don't play at all and still do well? And play it vs people who got there with that role as their main? Like wtf. And not even like every game, just randomly. Oh and then some of your games when you get your main role, the enemy got autofilled there so you just smash them, and learn nothing and in fact go backwards in skill because you learn bad habits from facing lower leveled players of that role. That's literally just luck, and nobody wants that factor in their ranked games. People want to be judged on their skill level and climb because they are skilled.

I'm not saying it's not bad to be in a game in the wrong role if you're a one-trick.  I'm saying that it is unsustainable for all the high MMR players to be one-tricks.  Before they put in autofill, they showed queue times of 20, even 30 minutes for the highest tier.  And at the time, they also admitted that matchmaking was giving poor match quality in terms of people's ranks.  To have good matches with respect to both rank and roles, the queue times would probably have to be several times that, and measuring a queue time in hours is just unreasonable.

LCS is obviously completely different than Solo/DynQueue.  If you want that experience, then you're going to have to find your own team to queue with in ranked teams, a support in particular because there just aren't enough to go around.

Most players are going to have to go back to whatever they did before Season 6, once they reach the point where they run into autofill.  Some number of players like yourself who would rather wait 40 minutes can dodge when they get autofilled, and that's fine.  But if everyone was so inflexible the queue would grind to a halt.

The old system was better lol. I get my primary role right now maybe.. 60% of the time? If that? 
Back in S3 when I was approaching Challenger, I got my role.......let's see...

My most played was of course Evelynn.. with 966 games.
My second most played was Nidalee... with 47 games. And I have a lot of champs at around 20-40 games so they all add up to about ~525 games.

With all the games added, considering I preferred mid for the majority of Season 3 (I mained mid but played Eve both mid and jungle) I only didn't get Eve or mid in ~200 games. That means I got my preferred role 85% of the time. EIGHTY FIVE PERCENT.

Out of ~1500 games, I played ADC a grand total of... TWICE. I have 12 additional games as Ezreal but I played him mid, didn't play him ADC. 

Autofill isn't like the old system. In the old system, everyone was used to forming a team with the strongest players on their preferred roles and the roles left over were distributed to whoever else capable. Now you just get thrown as a random role, and hey good luck! You might be able to get people to swap with you, but in the old system, anyone could have been a player of any role/lane. Now, if you get autofilled, you are guaranteed that not a single player on your team plays that role, because well thats why you got autofilled into it. That's a big difference. And again, someone might be able to play it as their 3rd or 4th best role, but when the enemy team mains that role you just get stomped. At that level you can't mess around like that. And that is the level that autofill is affecting.

Ah, I didn't realize you were able to get your primary role with such consistency in the previous seasons.  I feel like chances were high that with 5 random people that someone was going to be forced into a 3rd or 4th choice role, mathematically speaking.  But maybe there were people that have good enough 3rd and 4th choices that they didn't mind so much.  If that was the case, hopefully these people arise again as autofill continues and act as the people willing to swap roles if someone gets a role that is unworkable.

Out of curiosity, how often would you say you get either your primary or secondary role currently?  I understand that 'Eve or mid' probably doesn't include all the times you were jungling, but just to have an upper bound for comparison.

It also sounds like you particularly don't want to play ADC.  Would it make any difference to you if they let you rank the 3rd to 5th roles, when autofill gets enabled?  Or are you equally adamant about your 3rd and 4th roles?

I get my primary probably 5 or 6 out of 10 games. It's actually quite incredible how often I get mid with it as my secondary. I actually would prefer to NEVER mid, but I have no choice but to put it as my secondary. Honestly I would put support as my secondary instead but I would instantly become a support main so no thanks. If I could get my main 7 or 8 times out of 10 with Support as my secondary I'd do it. But the system is just shit. The old system worked fine, this system does not work for high elo at all.

I'd rather not play at all if autofill is enabled. Like if there was a popup saying 'you may be autofilled' I would just cancel queue and play another day or hour or whatever. It is absolute cancer. If I get up to the point of where I start getting autofilled, I will just quit. I wouldn't mind playing support if thats what I got filled into but I do NOT want to play ADC or Top, EVER. Or mid really, but it wouldn't be as big of a deal. Its going to force me to secondary support and never get my primary again just to avoid autofill. Stupid.

Hm, have you tried queuing Jungle/Support since they increased the primary role chance?  I think it was about a month ago.  People have said that it made a good amount of difference.  It's been about 50/50 for me with those roles, though of course low sample size and low elo.  Maybe it's reasonable enough now to be worth the trade-off?

Yes and it's not worth it. It's still really badly skewed toward Support and I'm just not interested in playing my secondary that often. Having mid is bad enough but like I said, I'd be fine with support secondary if it were 70-80% primary. Not interested in playing Support 40-60% of the time.
I'd agree to double my waiting time to guarantee my role so I'm really not sure why they ever though we would want autofill.
They didn't say people would really like it. They said it was the only option to have acceptable queue times and equal footing matches

So much yes. I agree with this you cant possibly put a tank toplane main play adc or an adc to jungle when the enemy has a jungle main ofc the skill difference in the said roles is gonna affect the game and i know how much it sucks to have a guy that doesnt play adc having to play it and not be able to kite/farm/position to the same degree as the guy who has 300games on the said role its frustrating and you cant do anything about it. But who cares as long as you are not flaming rito wont care lul

A problem that I notice is that support players consistently do not get into higher elos because their ranks depend on the other 4 players most of the time. The influence of a support is less than any other position in the game, meaning that climbing is much harder from support than it is in any other position. Because of this, there WILL always be less supports in all elos, just because there are less support mains because players want to be able to directly influence the outcome of the game. ATM I am plat 1 with 32,472 players in the NA server above me. That is not a very big number at all. I am willing to bet that the vast majority of them do not play support at all (and by vast majority I'm willing to bet that only 1/20th of them are support mains).

This is not inherently Riots fault that people do not like to play support. It would be nice to see more skill intensive supports added to the game, because at the moment it is the least populated role playerwise as well as championwise. Or they could at least make it so that more champions are support worthy.
I call BS, as i climbed from s3 into p3 in just 70 games, supp only. Bard & Vk only
I have just about 1000 support games from gold 2 to plat 1, Im not talking about all the other ranks here im talking about diamond +

On D+ supports carry even harder than until that point.
The whole idea of "supports can't climb/climb slower than carries" is just stupid. Supports carry in way subtler way, but their contribution is very comparable to any carry

Because all of season 6 was "Pick 2 roles and you'll always get those". Now the skill you had at the other 3 in previous seasons has just faded away since you've barely used it in the past year.

You, as well as others, seem to be barking on the wrong tree. The problem is not "fill" on role selection but the players who trolls ranked games.

The "fill" selection is only for those who can efficiently play any role as needed. It is not supposed to be used to queue faster. If you can play any role, then go ahead. If not, then wait for queue times.

No high ranked games have "auto fill" it works that even if you have mid/jungle selected it will still give you ADC if it needs adcs really bad.

And since their is VERY VERY few people who arent 1 trick ponys it messes up games.

that asking for a no from my experience

I certainly am not high elo, so I personally don't have any experience with autofill, but a Master jungle main friend of mine talks quite a bit about how ranked feels for him. For him (just from the general feel of playing against them) everything below D2 is trash, they might be very good players but still at a completely different level. So you can imagine what kind of a joke it is for him when he has to play his low-mid Dia midlane, adc or supp. He can play top if needed (which is his second role), but in most games he doesn't even really need to play if he gets autofilled.

In low elo most people don't even know how to close out games, so even if you feed the enemy top laner hard you can still always win the game, but in his Elo range when you make mistake in one of your bad roles you first get punched in the face, then kicked in the nuts and then left on the floor crying. There might be a few players in this Elo who just play almost everything, but in most cases players got there because they tried to train and optimize their play on one role.

It certainly must be annoying to have super long queue times, but autofill just makes quite a few games all about luck and who got autofilled or not, some games you might get carried, but in many others you'll just have beyond suboptimal role distribution making the game almost nonsense to play.

And then there's those of us that played before Season 6 and think you're being whiny when, for the majority of this game's lifetime, ranked has been a grab bag for roles. This is how ranked used to be and people were able to climb and you can do the same now, sometimes a person will be in a role they aren't the best at, shit happens even when everyone DOES get their role.

People need to learn to play more than one role, and how to accommodate their team's needs.
Nah pre season 6 all the one trick ponies bullied their way into the position they wanted. You know "mid or feed"
Uh.... that's what I said?
I think that a lot of people forget that ranked before Dynamic was pretty much autofill, but with lane stealing.

Even in low Elo it ruining it. Riot get rid of this crap. I am sick of getting in games where 2 people got autofill and do not know how to play anything beside their 2 chosen lanes. It so hard to climb when I keep getting 2-3 autofills.

Supports as a class are in the strongest position recently that they ever have been in league history. Large support discrepancies are usually the deciding factors in games, especially where all the best ADCs don't have dashes. That's not what this is really about but just my opinion lol

I'm not really sure about the ladder being stretched but as far as I've seen, the ladder has to reflect the skill curve which leads to some tiers being very lowly populated (which is fair). Even though this is true, the highest MMRs (lowly populated) have the players who play the most frequently, cutting our queue time by at least a little bit. Autofill kicks in mainly Dia5+ in my experience varying based on the amount of players in queue (it's on most frequently in the morning, where fewest people play rank).

the reason why it was stretched was because of the matchmaking making a lot of unfair games. Back then, the difference btw low diamond 1 and high diamond 1 was comparable to bronze and gold. Which is quite significant and counter intuitive to a matchmaking.
You do realize Autofill is basically the old Que system, correct?

True but they could have changed it so that you have a least desired option that basically will never happen.

Say you get jungle but you suck at jungle and would rank it as your least desired poition and you want top or mid.

But everyone else sucks at jungle besides your mid who got their most desired position and jungle is their third most desired so it does not help either of you out to. Your top will not trade you so you are stuck.

Meanwhile the other team has a extra person who is alright with jungling sometimes as their third most desired position but is in the same boat as you but they got top instead. 

Since you are not on the same team and the current system does not take into consideration anything besides the 2 positions that a person listed it is not going to be able to use anything else to make things better.

If they had you list most preferred to least preferred that would at least make it far less likely for you to get your least desired position.
You know why auto fill came about though right? Dynamic boosters gaming the system inflates wait times.
Theres no diamond 1 plus boosted people. Or at least they might only be 5% of the already only 1% of the total population.

Dynamic Boost was a joke. Group Queuing is still a huge factor causing the problems we are seeing. If you allow people to group together, that effectively knifes off a portion of a small population, limiting the matchmaker severely. This is why Riot had to reduce premade size at high ELO. Further, I don't have the numbers to say this for sure, but I strongly suspect the composition of groups is nowhere near balanced role-wise. This further stresses the matchmaker as it pulls from the reduced pool to fill the premade matches, exacerbating imbalances in the general solo population. This is why Riot had to implement auto-fill.

If you still don't understand, I can't really help you. I'd give you the mathematical formulas I used to run a Monte Carlo simulation to confirm my theory is viable, but you likely wouldn't be able to use them.
Lol. Smh and you guys wonder why no one listens. Great job immediately insulting my intelligence... does wonders for your argument.

Not intelligence, possible ignorance of mathematical/statistical/algorithmic modeling. I don't have 6 months to bring you up to speed with a crash course.

My point is that if you don't understand why my argument is a valid one, then you don't understand the math going on behind a system like this.

First of all, let's just understand that high elo can pretty much only get two of fast queues, fair matchmaking, and guaranteed roles. 

A lot of people say they would rather have long queues. Of course, when the queues actually get long, then suddenly it doesn't seem so great anymore. At the start of the season, there were wayyy more people complaining about long queue times in high elo than I've ever seen complaining about autofill.

Bad queue times make people quit playing a game mode faster than anything else. Maybe they will go to a smurf or just stop playing altogether. But few people want to spam games at 30-40 min queues, which then in turn makes the queues worse for everyone else. 

We had autofill every game for the past 5 seasons. This current system is clearly an improvement over that.
tl;dr OTP's get rekt with autofill
It is posts like this that got us DQ in the first place. No please.

I agree. Im currently in diamond 1 and i simply dont queue up when autofill is enabled. We finally have the chance to decide what roles we want to play, the entire idea behind the new championselect goes out the window when you get forced to play fill. If i wanted to sacrefice my role for a lower queue time i would pick fill myself, but i would rather wait longer to play a game i will enjoy in a position i enjoy playing.

Yeah it's funny that all the way back at the round table they mentioned 3 factors - Queue time, match quality, and role select. They didn't, however, mention that 2 of those factors are connected. Role select has an enormous influence on match quality and you pretty much ruin games now if you enforce role select unevenly.

I feel for you high elo players. Between all the pre-mades and auto fill, can't imagine ranked is a great experience right now. I mean yea.... its fun watching Dyrus, Imaqtpie, Aniiebot 3 man youtube videos. But the number of games pre-mades and auto fill ruin really is not worth it in my opinion.
